items.name: Name of Producer
items.comment: Part A 1:  List the producer's full legal name.  The full legal name means an individual's first name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or a nickname.

items.name: Tax Identification Number
items.comment: Part A 2 -   Enter the last 4 digits of the applicant's personal tax ID number. It is an identifying number for taxes purposes. This could be a social security number or EIN number depending on the type of entity.

items.name: Crop Year
items.comment: Part A 3 - Enter the current crop year you are farming

items.name: Names of affiliated persons with farming interests
items.comment: Part A 4:  Enter the full legal name of any affiliated persons.   An affiliated person has a farming interest (as owner, operator, or other producer on any farm), the affiliated person must also file Form AD-1026.

items.name: Check Boxes
items.comment: Part A 5:  Check "A" if the producer's will not use the land for agriculture purposes.  Check "B" if:  - The producer does not participate in any USDA programs that will need to be in compliance with HELC and WC certification.  - the producer will use the land primarily for agriculture use.  - This has not converted a wetland by draining, dredging, filling, leveling, removing woody vegetation, or any other activity that will damage or reduce the flow and circulation of water in a way that would allow the planting of perennial crops such as tree fruit, tree nuts, grapes, olives , native pasture and perennial forage.   NOTE:  Sugarcane is not a perennial crop and for alfalfa the producer should contact NRCS.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: HELC/WC Compliance Questions
parts.description: Indicate YES or NO to each question. If you are unsure of whether a HEL determination, wetland determination, or NRCS evaluation has been completed, contact your local USDA Service Center.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part B 6:  Check "YES" if the producer has not had a HEL determination on the land where the producer will plant any perennial crops or sugar cane. If otherwise, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Part B 7(A):  Check "YES" if the producer has created or will create new drainage systems, level, fill, dredge, clear, or excavate land that has NOT been seen by NRCS after December 23, 1985. If otherwise, check "NO".

items.name: Year #1
items.comment: If 7 A has be checked "YES" indicate the year(s) the activities listed above were performed,

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Part B 7(B):  Check "YES" if the producer has improved , or modified an existing drainage system that has NOT been seen by NRCS after December 23, 1985. If otherwise, check "NO".

items.name: Year #2
items.comment: Part 7 B:   If 7 B has be checked "YES" indicate the year(s) the activities listed above were performed,

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Part B 7(C):  Check "YES" if the producer has repaired, restored, reconstruct, or replaced an existing drainage system that has NOT been seen by NRCS after December 23, 1985. If otherwise, check "NO".

items.name: Part C Note
items.comment: Part 7 NOTE:  If Part B 7A or 7B have been checked "Yes", continue to Part C. NRCS will need a HELC/WL certification.  If Part B 7C has been checked "YES", a HELC/WL certification does not need to be complete by NRCS.

items.name: Check Box A
items.comment: Part B 8(A):  Check box "A" if the producer and/or affiliates have FCIC re-insured crop insurance and has been subjected to HELC/WC provisions.

items.name: Check Box B
items.comment: Part B 8(B):  Check box "B" if the producer is a:  - Tenant, who occupies land rented from a landlord, is or will not be in compliance due to the refusal of the landlord.  - Landlord is or will not be in compliance due to a violation by a tenant, who occupies land rented from a landlord.  NOTES:   If other land not associated with the landlord are in compliance, the tenant will need to complete Form AD-1026B, "Tenant Exemption Request", must be completed.  If other land not associated with the landlord are in compliance, the landlord will need to complete Form AD-1026C, "Landlord or Landowner Exemption Request" must be completed

items.name: Part C
items.comment: Part C: If Part B 6 or 7 has been checked "YES",  provide the following:  A. The farm tract number is available from FSA - Farm Program Section.  B.- Specify the the activity or activities that will be completed on the land. For example, creating new drainage systems, leveling, filling, dredging, clearing, or excavating land  C.- Describe the current use of the land.  D.-List the county where the land is located.

items.name: Producer's Signature
items.comment: Part D 10(A):  Enter the producer's signature  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Title/Relationship
items.comment: Part 10 B:  All entity members who apply should complete the AD1026 and sign as individuals. The entity member who has the authority to sign on behalf of the entity as the "authorized entity representative" will need to sign on behalf of them self and on behalf of the entity. They will need to sign as "Self" and sign as an "Entity Representative".   The members that do not have the authority to sign on behalf of the entity will only sign as themselves.   Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part 10 C:  Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Signature of FSA Representative
items.comment: Part 11A  FSA USE ONLY:  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part 11B:  FOR FSA USE ONLY: Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Name of Applicant
items.comment: Enter your full legal name, on individuals first name, middle name and last name without the use of initials or nicknames. If this is an entity, enter the entity name.

parts.name: Part A
parts.title: Land
parts.description: Include all land owned, to be owned, or leased.

items.name: Owner of Record
items.comment: Part A 1a - The landowner of record (deed and title holder) of the property you will be farming.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A 1b -   Enter a general description such as section, township, and range, and current use of land for each property that you own, lease (long term - typically greater than 12 months) , rent (short term), or plan to purchase.

items.name: County
items.comment: Part A 1c -   Enter the county where the land is located.

items.name: Farm No.
items.comment: Part A 1d -   Enter the farm tract number of the land you own, lease or plan to purchase. The farm tract number is available from FSA - Farm Program Section.   For newly purchased land, it is required that you obtain a tract number from FSA - Farm Program Section.

items.name: Total Acres
items.comment: Part A 1e -   Enter the total number of acres assigned specifically to this farm tract number for the property you own, lease or plan to purchase.

items.name: Crop Acres
items.comment: Part A 1f -   Enter the total number of crop acres assigned specifically to this farm tract number for the property you own, lease or plan to purchase.

items.name: Oral/Written Lease
items.comment: Part A 1g -   If you have a lease, state whether it is an oral or written.

items.name: Crop Share
items.comment: Part A 1h -  Enter the percentage of crop share portion that you will own after harvesting.

items.name: Cash Rent
items.comment: Part A 1i -  If renting this property, enter the cash rent payment amount due to landowner.

items.name: Expiration Date
items.comment: Part A 1j -  If leasing this property, enter the expiration date of the lease contract.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Equipment/Livestock
parts.description: Include only equipment/livestock to be purchased, currently leased, or to be leased.

items.name: Owner of Record
items.comment: Part B 1 -   Enter the owner of record for the equipment or livestock that you lease, and/or or plan to lease or purchase.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part B 2 -   Describe the type of equipment (include color, serial number, make and model number) or livestock (include tag number, brand, description, and color) leased, and/or or plan to lease or purchase.

items.name: Number of Units
items.comment: Part B 3 -   Enter the number of livestock or pieces of equipment leased, and/or or plan to lease or purchase.

items.name: Rent ($)
items.comment: Part B 4 -  Enter the cash rent payment amount due to Owner of record.

items.name: Share (%)
items.comment: Part B 5 -   Enter the percentage of share for equipment and/or livestock leased, and/or or plan to lease or purchase.

items.name: Type of Lease
items.comment: Part B 6 -  If you have a lease, state whether it is an oral or written.

items.name: Expiration Date
items.comment: Part B 7 -  If leasing equipment and/or livestock, enter the expiration date of the lease contract.

parts.name: Part C
parts.title: Certification
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warning: Section 1001 of title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part C1 -   Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part C 2 -   Enter the specific month, day and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Name and Address of Applicant
items.comment: Part A, Item 3 List the applicants full legal name.  The full legal name means an an individual's first name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or a nickname.  List the applicants mailing address location.  This will include the name of the registered street, the town/city and state.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Part A, Item 6(A) FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will print their name.

items.name: Title
items.comment: Part A, Item 6 (B) FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will list their official title (their professional title).

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part A, Item 6 (C) FSA USE ONLY - The Agency Official processing this form will list their signature.    Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part A, Item 6 (D) FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will list the month, date, and year this form is being completed to send to the Creditor.

items.name: Type of debt
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 List the type of debt for each account verified.  For example, is the debt a  personal or business debt. Then list if the debt is secured, unsecured, revolving, or an installment debt.

items.name: Account number
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (A) List the account number which is a unique set of numbers used to identity the applicant's specific account for this column.

items.name: Date of origination
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (B) List the initial date that the loan or account was originally opened.

items.name: Current principal balance
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (C) List the amount still owed on the original  debt financed without any interest or finance charges that are due.

items.name: Accrued interest
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (D) List the amount of interest that has been incurred/computed as of a specific accounting date that has not been paid.

items.name: Daily interest accrual
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (E) List the daily dollar amount of interest added to the account balance.

items.name: Effective date of Items C and D
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (F) List the date which the loan or account is being currently reviewed for items 1C and 1D.

items.name: Original loan amount/LOC ceiling
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (G) List the principal amount of the loan originally made to the applicant.

items.name: Last date payment made
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (H) List the last date a payment was made on the loan or account.

items.name: Interest rate
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (I) List the interest rate and indicate whether the Interest rate is a Fixed Rate, which does not fluctuate during the period of the loan or a Variable Rate, which fluctuates over time because it is based on a benchmark interest rate or index.

items.name: Installment amount
items.comment: Part B , Item 1 (J) List the installment amount, which is the payment due.

items.name: Next Installment due date
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (K) List the specific date on which such a regular payment is due for the loan or account.

items.name: Amount past due
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (L) List the amount past due, which refers to a payment that has not been made by the deadline.

items.name: Description of collateral
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (M) List a brief description or name of the item(s) used to secure the loan or account being verified.

items.name: Maturity date
items.comment: Part B, Item 1 (N) List the date which the final payment is due on the loan or account being verified.

items.name: Applicant's repayment record is
items.comment: Part B, Item 2 Prompt - Payment is made timely without delay.  Usually Prompt - Under normal conditions payment is made on time.  Not Prompt - Payment is not made timely

items.name: Number of years applicant has conducted business with you
items.comment: Part B, Item 3 List the number of years the applicant has conducted business transactions with your institution.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part B, Item 4  Check "Yes" if there is an hereafter acquired clause, which allows any assets the debtor acquires at a later point in time will be added to the list of collateral that was put in place with the debt or loan agreement.  Check "No" if there is not an hereafter acquired clause, which does not allow any assets the debtor acquires at a later point in time to be added to the list of collateral.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Part B, Item 5 Check "Yes" if there is a clause in a loan contract that allows the borrower to receive additional funds after the loan is initially disbursed.  Check "No" if there is not a clause in a loan contract that allows the borrower to receive additional funds after the loan is initially disbursed.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Part B, Item 6 Check "Yes" if you would enter into another loan agreement with the borrower.  Check "No" if you will not enter into another loan agreement with the borrower.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Part B, Item 7 Check "Yes" if you would extend additional credit with a FSA Guarantee in place.  Check "No" if you will not enter into another loan agreement with the borrower.

items.name: Type of asset
items.comment: Part C, Item 1 List items that you may own, can be considered valuable and can be used for security. For example, cash, jewelry, receivables, prepaid expenses, inventory, equipment, livestock, land, automobile, and etc.

items.name: Account number
items.comment: Part C, Item 1(A) List the account number which is a unique set of numbers used to identify the borrower's specific account.

items.name: Date of origination
items.comment: Part C, Item 1 (B) List the initial date that the loan or account was originally opened.

items.name: Balance
items.comment: Part C, Item 1 (C) List the specific dollar amount balance of the account.

items.name: Interest rate
items.comment: Part C, Item 1 (D) Interest rate is the amount a borrower is charged for borrowing money.

items.name: Annuity amount
items.comment: Part C, Item1 (E) Annuity Amount is a series of payments made at equal intervals. For example, regular deposits to a savings account, monthly insurance payments or pension payments.

items.name: Maturity date
items.comment: Part C, Item1 (F) Maturity Date is the date which the final payment is due on a loan or account.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part C, Item 2 Check "Yes" if you will impose a penalty should the borrower's deposit or investment account be withdrawn prior to maturity.  Check "No" if you will not impose a penalty should the borrower's deposit or investment account be withdrawn prior to maturity.

items.name: Additional information
items.comment: Part D, Item 1 Enter any information that may be pertinent to the account

items.name: Name of Institution's Representative
items.comment: Part D,Item 2 The name of the Institution's Representative completing this document will print their name.

items.name: Title of Institution's Representative
items.comment: Part D,Item 3 The Institution's Representative completing this document will list their professional title.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part D, Item 4 The Institution's Representative completing this document will sign the form.  The signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part D, Item 5 List the specific month, date, and year the Institution's Representative has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment: Part D, Item 6 List a working sequence of digital number's that is assigned to a particular creditor used to connect with a telephone line.

parts.name: Part A
parts.title: Individual Applicant
parts.description: Individual applicants and married applicants with a non-applicant spouse will complete Items 1 through 16. Items 11, 14 and 15 are voluntary. *Race, ethnicity, and gender information is requested by the Federal Government to monitor FSA's compliance with Federal laws prohibiting discrimination against applicants. Applicants are not required to furnish this information but are encouraged to do so. Failure to provide this information may result in not receiving targeted funds for which the applicant may be eligible. This information will not be used to evaluate this application.

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Part A 1: List the applicant's full legal name.  The full legal name means an individual's first name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or a nickname.

items.name: Email Address
items.comment: Part A 2: Enter the applicant's e-mail address.

items.name: Mailing Address
items.comment: Part A 3:  List the applicants mailing address location.  This will include the name of the registered street, the town/city and state.

items.name: Physical Address
items.comment: Part A 4(A):  List the applicants physical address location.  This will include the name of the registered street, the town/city and state.

items.name: County of Residence
items.comment: Part A 4(B):   Enter the county where the applicant's residence is located.

items.name: Contact Telephone Numbers
items.comment: Part A 5:  Enter the applicant's home (landline), cell and/or business telephone number, as applicable.  Indicate applicant's best contact telephone number by selecting "Primary" in the applicable box.

items.name: County of Operation Headquarters
items.comment: Part A 6 :  Enter the county where the applicant's farming headquarters is located.  County may be where your farming headquarters is located or where the majority of your farming operation is located. The homestead maybe used as headquarters.   The county operation headquarters must match the FSA Farm Program Records.

items.name: Date of Birth
items.comment: Part A 7:  Enter the applicant's date of birth.

items.name: Social Security Number
items.comment: Part A 8:  Enter the applicant's social security number (9 digit number).

items.name: Name and Address of Employer
items.comment: Part A 9:  Name and Address of Employer  If self employed, then state self employed. If you own your business and are responsible for the success or failure, please state here.

items.name: Citizenship Question
items.comment: Part A 10:   Applicant is:  Check the applicable citizenship status.  If non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, as defined by the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996, 8 U.S. C. 1641, cosigner must provide copies of appropriate documentation of immigration status including and not limited, to a current I-551, Naturalization Certificate, or I688B.  Other than U.S. Citizen, please provide documentation to document immigration

items.name: Race
items.comment: Part A 11:  Race:   Check the appropriate box indicating applicant's race.  More than one box may be checked.  Providing applicant's race is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on race, this information is required.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to race

items.name: Veteran Status
items.comment: Part A 12:  Veteran Status   This will not automatically determine whether the applicant is qualified or approved.   Veteran is anyone who has served in the U.S. armed services. A Veteran Farmer without military experience does not qualify as a Veteran.

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Part A 13:  Check the appropriate box depending on whether the applicant is unmarried, separated, or married applying as an individual.

items.name: Ethnicity Question
items.comment: Part A 14:   Providing applicant's ethnicity is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on ethnicity, this information is required.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to ethnicity

items.name: Gender
items.comment: Part A 15:   Providing applicant's gender is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on gender, this information is required.   Non- Binary is defined as an individual who identifies as neither male or female.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to gender.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the applicant completed this form.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Married Couple, Applying Jointly
parts.description: Married couples (not legal entity) who are joint operators of the operation, are applying jointly, and who have not formed a legal entity will complete the sections. Items 7, 10 and 11 are voluntary. The other spouse will complete Items 13 through 23; Items 19, 22 and 23 are voluntary. Items 25 through 28 pertain to both applicants jointly.

parts.name: Part C
parts.title: Entity Applicant
parts.description: An entity is a corporation, formal, joint operation, Limited Liability Corporation, Trust or other legal business organization comprised of 1 or more individuals which may or may not have an entity name or entity tax identification number. Organizations operating as non-profit entities and Estates are not considered eligible entities for Farm Loan Program purposes. Informal entities may leave Items 3 through 8 blank. Items 21, 24 and 25 are voluntary. All other information must be provided on each entity associated with the operation and each individual member of the associated entity. NOTE: Individual liability is required regardless of entity type.

items.name: Full Entity or Trust Name
items.comment: Part C 1 - Full Entity or Trust Name   Please use the full legal Entity name from the Entity certificate. The entity name is the legal name of your business. Information must match Farm Programs. (CCC902). The operating entity must be authorized to operate a farm in the state (or states) in which the farm is located.  The Entity or Trust name must match the FSA Farm Program Records.

items.name: Entity Address
items.comment: Part C 2 - Entity Address  The address from the operation, if different from mailing address. Use the same address as indicated in the Entity Agreement.

items.name: Entity Type
items.comment: Part C 3 - Entity Type  Please provide documentation to support the  entity type chosen.   An entity is an organization created by an individual or individuals to conduct business under an assigned identification

items.name: Entity Contact Telephone Number
items.comment: Part C 4 -  Enter the Entity's contact telephone number.

items.name: State of Registration/Corporation
items.comment: Part C 5:  The state in which the entity was registered

items.name: Registration ID Number
items.comment: Part C 6 - Registration ID Number   The registration ID number is the unique identification number assigned to the entity. The registration ID number is not the same as a SSN or Federal EIN. Please enter the registration ID from the entity agreement

items.name: Date of Formation
items.comment: Part C 7 - Date of Formation   The date the entity was formed as indicated on the entity certificate.

items.name: Tax Identification Number
items.comment: Part C 8:  Enter the applicant's personal tax ID number. It is an identifying number for taxes purposes. This could be a social security number or EIN number depending on the type of entity.

items.name: County of Operation Headquarters
items.comment: Part C 9 -   Enter the county where the applicant's farming headquarters is located.  County may be where your farming headquarters is located or where the majority of your farming operation is located. The homestead maybe used as headquarters.   The county operation headquarters must match the FSA Farm Program Records.

items.name: Embedded Entity Question
items.comment: Part C 10 -   Check "YES" if the Entity contains an embedded entity.  Check "NO" if the Entity does not contain an embedded entity.  Embedded entity means an entity that has a direct or indirect interest as a stockholder, member, beneficiary, or otherwise another entity.

items.name: List all Embedded Entities
items.comment: Part C 11 -   Check "YES" if the Entity contains an embedded entity.  Check "NO" if the Entity does not contain an embedded entity.  Embedded entity means an entity that has a direct or indirect interest as a stockholder, member, beneficiary, or otherwise another entity.

items.name: Percentage of Interest
items.comment: Part C 12 :  Each member must list the percentage owned in the entity or entities.

items.name: Number of Entity Members
items.comment: Part C 13:  Enter the number of individuals that make up the entity. This must match your entity agreement. If changes have been made, the entity agreement needs to be legally updated.

items.name: Entity Member #1 Questions
items.comment: Part C 14-28  Enter the number of individuals that make up the entity. This must match your entity agreement. If changes have been made, the entity agreement needs to be legally updated.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the applicant completed this form.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Entity Member #2 Questions
items.comment: Part C 14-28 Continued -   Start listing E2 member information

items.name: Entity Member #3 Questions
items.comment: Part C 14-28 Continued -   Start listing E3 member information

items.name: Additional Pages
items.comment: Part C Note:  If more pages are needed for entity members, please print page 3 of 8 and attach to the application.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the applicant completed this form.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Counties Being Farmed
items.comment: Part D 1 -   List counties being farmed and to be farmed. This must match the producer data report from FSA Farm Programs. If you are renting/leasing any farm land, you must have agreements in place for these farms between you and the landowner.

items.name: Acres Owned
items.comment: Part D 2:  Enter the total number of acre(s) you own. If none, enter 0.

items.name: Acres Rented
items.comment: Part D 3:  Enter the total number of acre(s) rented or leased in all counties farmed. If none, enter 0.

items.name: Purpose of Loan
items.comment: Part D 4a - Purpose of Loan  Indicate whether this will be an Annual Operating, Term Operating, Farm Ownership, or Emergency Loan.   Do you need an annual operating loan to pay seed, taxes, insurance, to purchase feeder calves or stockers etc? If so, you will need an Annual Operating Loan.   Do you need to purchase equipment, livestock, or refinance debt? If so, you will need an Term Operating loan.   Do you need to purchase real estate, make capital improvements to the farm, or new construction projects? You will need a Farm Ownership loan.   Have you suffered a loss to your farming operation due to a natural disaster? If so, you will need an Emergency loan.  Emergency loan programs are triggered by a natural disaster as designated by the Secretary of Agriculture. These loans help producers who suffered qualifying farm related losses directly caused by the disaster and a county declared or designated as a disaster or quarantined area.   Please note that more than one loan or any combination of two loans may be requested. If so, please put your first loan request in 4A and your second loan request in 5A. For example, an applicant may request an Annual Operating, Term Operating and a Farm Ownership loan at the same time. Another example, an applicant can request a combination of any two loans.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Part D 4b - Amount Requested  How much are you requesting for loan purpose listed in 4A?

items.name: Purpose of Loan
items.comment: Part D 5a - Purpose of Loan  Indicate whether this will be an Annual Operating, Term Operating, Farm Ownership, or Emergency Loan.   Do you need an annual operating loan to pay seed, taxes, insurance, to purchase feeder calves or stockers etc? If so, you will need an Annual Operating Loan.   Do you need to purchase equipment, livestock, or refinance debt? If so, you will need an Term Operating loan.   Do you need to purchase real estate, make capital improvements to the farm, or new construction projects? You will need a Farm Ownership loan.   Have you suffered a loss to your farming operation due to a natural disaster? If so, you will need an Emergency loan.  Emergency loan programs are triggered by a natural disaster as designated by the Secretary of Agriculture. These loans help  producers who suffered qualifying farm related losses directly caused by the disaster and a county declared or designated as a disaster or quarantined area.   Please note that more than one loan or any combination of two loans may be requested. If so, please put your first loan request in 4A and your second loan request in 5A. For example, an applicant may request an Annual Operating, Term Operating and a Farm Ownership loan at the same time. Another example, an applicant can request a combination of any two loans.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Part D 5B - Amount Requested   How much are you requesting for loan purpose listed in 5A?

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part E 1:  Check "YES" if you ever conducted business under any other name, otherwise check "NO".  If "YES" provide the names used in Item 9.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Part E 2:  Check "YES" if you ever obtained a Direct or Guaranteed Farm Loan from FSA or the Farmers Home Administration; otherwise check "NO". If "YES" provide the details used in Item 9.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Part E 3:   If item 2 is "YES," check "YES" if the government ever forgave any debt through write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy.  If "YES," provide details in Item 9, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Part E 4:  Check "YES" if you are delinquent on any federal debt (i.e. "Federal Debt" includes but is not limited to education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, or have an outstanding Federal judgment, etc.).  If "YES", provide details in Item 9, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment: Part E 5:  Check "YES" if you are involved in any pending litigation (i.e. divorce, law suit, etc.).  If "YES" provide details in Item 9, otherwise check "NO"

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment: Part E 6:  If item 6 is "YES," check "YES" if the government ever forgave any debt through write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy.  If "YES," provide details in Item 8, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment: Part E 7:  Check "YES" if you are an employee and related to a FSA employee, or closely associated with an FSA employee of the Farm Service Agency.  If "YES" provide details in Item 9, otherwise check "NO."

items.name: Yes/No Question #8
items.comment: Part E 8:  Please explain if you are farming now. If not, please indicate the years farmed in the past and the type operation.

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment: Part E 9:   Provide explanations to any "YES" responses to Items 1-8. Use additional space as needed.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the applicant completed this form.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the applicant completed this form.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Initials
items.comment: Enter applicant's initials.  All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

parts.name: Part F
parts.title: Certification and Signatures
parts.description: CERTIFICATION: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith to obtain a loan. (WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements to the Government. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action).

items.name: Signature of Individual Applicant, Spouse or Entity Member
items.comment: Part F 1(A):  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.   All entity members who apply should sign the Form FSA-2001 as individuals. They must indicate this by checking the "Self" box. The entity member who has the authority to sign on behalf of the entity as the "authorized entity representative" will need to sign on behalf of them self and on behalf of the entity (sign and check both boxes). They will need to sign as "Self" and sign as an "Entity Representative".   The members that do not have the authority to sign on behalf of the entity will only sign as themselves (check the "Self" box).

items.name: Amount of Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: Part G 3(A):  FSA USE ONLY: A credit report fee is charged each time a new application is filed. The credit report fee amount will depend on whether the applicant applies as an individual, joint entity, or an entity.    The credit report fee is nonrefundable.

items.name: Date Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: Part G 3(B):  FSA USE ONLY: The date the credit report fee was received.

items.name: Type of Assitance Requested
items.comment: Part G 4:  FSA USE ONLY: Indicate the type of assistance the applicant is requesting

items.name: Name of Agency Official Receiving Application

Forms.name: FSA-2002 Three-Year Financial History
Forms.description: A detailed three years financial history. This form is not required. Applicant may submit alternate documents that provide the information collected on this form.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter the full legal name as an individual. First name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or nicknames.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Part A -  Enter the last 3 years in the columns provided.  Two digits for each column.

items.name: Crop Sales
items.comment: Part A 1:   Enter the total dollar amount for all crop sales in the column for the year in which the crop was sold.

items.name: Livestock & Poultry Sales
items.comment: Part A 2:   Enter the total dollar amount of sales for all livestock and/or poultry in each of the three years.

items.name: Dairy Livestock Sales
items.comment: Part A 3:   Enter the total dollar amount of sales for all dairy livestock for each of the three years listed. i.e. dairy cull cows, cull bulls, dairy heifers, etc.

items.name: Milk Sales
items.comment: Part A 4:  Enter the total dollar amount of all milk sales for each of the 3 years.

items.name: Livestock Product Sales
items.comment: Part A 5:  Enter the total dollar amount of sales for all livestock product sales (fur, leather, wool, eggs, livestock meats such as pork, veal, beef, and lamb, etc.)  for each year.

items.name: Ag. Program Payments
items.comment: Part A 6:  Enter the total dollar amount of Ag Program payments received for each of the years listed.

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds
items.comment: Part A 7:  Enter the total dollar amount of all crop insurance proceeds received for each year.

items.name: Custom Hire Income
items.comment: Part A 8:  Enter the total dollar amount of custom hire income received for each of the 3 years listed.

items.name: Other Income
items.comment: Part A 9:   Enter the total dollar amount of all other farm related income sources for each of the years listed.  i.e. refunds, cooperative dividends, farm rebates, manure sales, seed sales, fertilizer sales, rental machinery income, rental  farm land income, etc.

items.name: Total Operating Income
items.comment: Part A 10:  Enter the total income from lines 1 through 9 for each column year.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Operating Expenses
parts.description: Enter the expense amount for each item listed in B.1.-B24 for each of the most recent 3 years.

items.name: Car and Truck
items.comment: Part B 1:  Gas, tires, repairs and license.

items.name: Chemicals
items.comment: Part B 2:  A chemical substance used on the farm such as herbicides, pesticides, and fungicides.

items.name: Conservation
items.comment: Part B 3 - Focus on protecting and maintaining, restoring farmland and the inhabitants in farmland. For example, nutrient management plans, tiling, brush control, draining system, gully structures, and poultry energy updates.

items.name: Custom Hire
items.comment: Part B 4: A payment for work or services that has been done to your farm by another self-employed person or business (contract hire or machine hire work).

items.name: Depreciation
items.comment: Part B 5:  A reduction in the value of an asset over time, due particularly to wear and tear.

items.name: Feed Supplement
items.comment: Part B 6:  Feed supplements are phosphates, calcium, and trace mineral mixtures that can be given to grazing animals during the dry and rainy season.

items.name: Feed, Grain, and Roughage
items.comment: Part B 7:  Concentrates, grains, hay

items.name: Fertilizers and Lime
items.comment: Part B 8:   Enter the cost of fertilizer you use, in addition to your calcium, on the farm

items.name: Freight and Trucking
items.comment: Part B 9:   Transportation costs to move goods to and from the farm.

items.name: Gas/Fuel/Oil
items.comment: Part B 10:   Cost of gas, fuel and oil for farm usage.

items.name: Insurance
items.comment: Part B 11 - Insurance is a compensation for specified farm loss, damage, illness, or death in return of a payment of a premium.

items.name: Labor Hired
items.comment: Part B 12 - Labor hired is a form of employment in which an employer directs their employees to perform work at an external workplace, belonging to the client of the legal employer and has no direct employment contract

items.name: Rent - Machinery/Equipment/Vehicle
items.comment: Part B 13:  Costs associated of machinery/equipment/vehicle rentals for a temporary purpose to help people who do not own the equipment.

items.name: Rent - Land/Animals
items.comment: Part B 14:   Land rent is for a temporary purpose that permits the tenant to use a piece of land owned by the landlord in exchange of rent. Animal rent includes animals who are hired out at a specific rate for a specific time.

items.name: Repairs and Maintenance
items.comment: Part B 15:   To fix, mend or restore to former conditions to an object or item for operational soundness.

items.name: Seeds and Plants
items.comment: Part B 16:  Costs associated with inputs for crops in the operation.

items.name: Supplies
items.comment: Part B 17:  Essential items needed for the farm. For example, equipment, tools, and twines.

items.name: Taxes - Real Estate
items.comment: Part B 18:   A tax levied on real estate property to be paid to local and state governments.

items.name: Utilities
items.comment: Part B 19:  Utilities of a basic service that may include water, electricity, gas, trash, and sewage. Technology subscriptions may include cable tv, internet, security, and phone services.

items.name: Veterinary/Breeding/Medicine
items.comment: Part B 20:   Costs associated with the treatment of animals related to diseases, birth, injuries, and medications.

items.name: Purchases for Resale
items.comment: Part B 21:   Direct costs attributed to the production of goods sold by a business.

items.name: Other Expenses
items.comment: Part B 22:  Any other expenses associated not listed above, such as costs associated with appraisals, attorney fees, surveys, accounting costs, bank fees, closing costs, etc.

items.name: Other - Irrigation
items.comment: Part B 23:  Irrigation is the agricultural process of applying controlled amounts of water to land to assist in the production of crops.

items.name: Interest
items.comment: Part B 24:  The cost of borrowing money over a specific time.

items.name: Total Operating Expenses
items.comment: Part B 25 - Enter the combine total of all expenses listed from Part B 1 through Part B 24.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Part C:  Enter the last 3 years in the columns provided.  Two digits for each column.

items.name: Owner Withdrawal
items.comment: Part C 1:  Enter the total dollar amount of all family living expenses and all non-farm debt payments (i.e. car loans, personal loans, credit cards, etc.) for each year.

items.name: Income Taxes
items.comment: Part C 2:  Enter the total State and Federal income taxes paid in each of the three years.  Information should be available from your Federal and State Tax return forms.

items.name: Non-Farm Income
items.comment: Part C 3:  Enter the total dollar amount of income received from all non-farm sources for each of the 3 years.

items.name: Non-Farm Expense
items.comment: Part C 4:  Enter the total dollar amount of non-farm expenses associated with non-farm businesses and charitable contributions for each of the three years.

items.name: Term Principal Payment
items.comment: Part D 1 - Principal payment is a payment toward the original amount of a loan that is owed. For example, machinery, livestock and real estate payment.

items.name: Operating Loan Advance
items.comment: Part D 2:  Enter the total dollar amount of the operating loan full or partial advance of proceeds for each of the three years list. May include a revolving account.

items.name: Term Loan Advance
items.comment: Part D 3 - Enter the total dollar amount received for the term loan advances for each of the three years. Include loans for capital purchases such as machinery, equipment, breeding livestock, real estate, etc.

items.name: Operating Loan Payment
items.comment: Part D 4 - A farm operating loan or line of credit is a revolving debt that can be borrowed and paid back to fund the yearly operating costs of farm operations.  Enter the total dollar amount paid for operating loans for each of the three years listed.  If you received loans from more than one source combine them into a single total.

items.name: Capital Sales
items.comment: Part E 1:  Enter the total dollar amount received from the sale of depreciable items. (equipment, breeding livestock, etc.) and real estate during each of the three years listed.

items.name: Capital Contributions
items.comment: Part E 2:  Enter the total dollar amount of the inflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or other income for each of the three years. Capital contributions usually includes gifts, inheritance, lottery winnings, the gift value of substantial asset purchases for less than market value, and the capital contributions of entity members.  Make sure NOT to include amounts already in capital sales listed in E.1.

items.name: Capital Expenditures
items.comment: Part E 3:  Enter the total dollar amount of the purchases of depreciable items (equipment, breeding livestock, etc) and real estate during each of the three listed years.

items.name: Capital Withdrawals
items.comment: Part E 4 - Enter the total dollar amount of outflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or owner withdrawals for each of the three years.  Capital withdrawals usually include gifts, the gift value of substantial sales of assets for less than market value, and withdrawal of capital of entity members.  Do NOT include outflows already included in capital expenditures.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part F 1:  Enter the applicant (s) signature  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part F 2:   Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

Forms.name: FSA-2003 Three-Year Production History
Forms.description: A detailed three years production history. This form is not required. Applicant may submit alternate documents that provide the information collected on this form.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter the applicant's name.

items.name: Dairy Cows
items.comment: Part A 1:  For each column enter the last two digits of the year for which information is provided.  Complete the appropriate column for the year that information is being provided.   i.e. 2021, 2020, 2019

items.name: Herd Number
items.comment: Part 1(a):  Enter the average number of cows for each year listed in the appropriate column.

items.name: Lbs. of Milk Sold
items.comment: Part A 1(b):  Enter the total pounds of milk sold in each column for that year.

items.name: Average Production Per Cow
items.comment: Part A 1(c):  Enter the average pounds of milk sold per cow for each of the three years.  The average should be the pounds of milk sold (A1b)divided by the average number of cows (A1a) for each year.

items.name: Calves Sold
items.comment: Part A 1(d):  Enter the total number of calves sold for each of the three years.

items.name: Calves Average Sale Weight
items.comment: Part A 1(e):  Enter the average weight of calves at the time they were sold for each of the three years.

items.name: Number of Cows Culled
items.comment: Part A 1(f):  Enter the total number of cull cows sold and cows that died for each of the three years.

items.name: Livestock Type
items.comment: Part B 1:  Enter the type of livestock being raised (cattle, hogs, sheep, etc.).  When applicable break down the type of livestock for each specific type such as "brood cows," "market animals", "calves", "market hogs", "market lambs", "breeding stock ewes", etc.  Each type should be entered separately.

items.name: Units Raised
items.comment: Part B 1(a):   Enter the number of livestock that were raised (for the specific "type" described only) for each of the three years.

items.name: Units Purchased
items.comment: Part B 1(b):  Enter the number of livestock (for the "type" described) that were purchased in each of the three years.

items.name: Total Units
items.comment: Part B 1(c):  Enter the total number (the total of units raised B1a plus the units purchased B1b) for each of the three years.

items.name: Units Sold
items.comment: Part B 1 (d):  Enter the total number of livestock of this type that were sold during each of the three years.

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: Part B 1(e):  Enter the total number of animals lost due to death for the type described in item B1 for each of the three years.

items.name: Purchase Weight
items.comment: Part B 1(f):  Enter the average weight per unit of livestock that was purchased for sale in each of the three years listed.

items.name: Sales Weight
items.comment: Part B 1(g):  Enter the average weight per unit of livestock that was sold in each of the three years listed.

items.name: Years

items.name: Crop Description
items.comment: Part C 1:  Enter a description for each type of crop and how that unit is marketed (bushels, pounds, etc.) for all raised crops in each of the three years.  Complete a separate section for each type of crop raised including crops that were only raised for a portion of that particular year.

items.name: Total Yield

items.name: Cosigner's Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Part A 1:  Enter the cosigner's exact full legal name as shown on a state driver's license or State ID card.

items.name: Cosigner's Email Address
items.comment: Part A 2:  Enter the cosigner's e-mail address.

items.name: Cosigner's Mailing Address
items.comment: Part A 3:  Enter the cosigner's complete mailing address.  Indicate if the mailing address is different from the cosigner's physical address.

items.name: Cosigner's Physical Address
items.comment: Part A 4(A):  Enter the cosigner's complete physical address if different from the mailing address.

items.name: Cosigner's County of Residence
items.comment: Part A 4(B):  Enter the county where the cosigner's residence is located.

items.name: Cosigner's Contact Telephone Numbers
items.comment: Part A 5:  Enter the cosigner's home (landline), cell and/or business telephone number, as applicable.  Indicate cosigner's best contact telephone number by selecting "Primary" in the applicable box.

items.name: Applicant for Which You Are Agreeing to Cosign
items.comment: Part A 6:  Enter the name of the applicant for which the cosigner is agreeing to cosign for.

items.name: Cosigner's Date of Birth
items.comment: Part A(7):  Enter the cosigner's date of birth.

items.name: Cosigner's Social Security Number
items.comment: Part A 8:  Enter the cosigner's social security number (9 digit number).

items.name: Name and Address of Cosigner's Employer
items.comment: Part A 9:  Enter the name, address and telephone number of the cosigner's employer, if applicable. If self-employed, state "self".

items.name: Cosigner Citizenship Quesion
items.comment: Part A 10:  Check the applicable citizenship status.  If non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, as defined by the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996, 8 U.S. C. 1641, cosigner must provide copies of appropriate documentation of immigration status including and not limited, to a current I-551, Naturalization Certificate, or I688B.  Other than U.S. Citizen, please provide documentation to document immigration status.

items.name: Race
items.comment: Part A 11:  Check the appropriate box indicating cosigner's race.  More than one box may be checked.  Providing cosigner's race is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on race, this information is required.

items.name: Veteran Status
items.comment: Part A 12:  This will not automatically determine whether the cosigner is qualified or approved.   Veteran - anyone who has served in the U.S. armed services.   Explain what a veteran is. Veteran Status does not equal military experience

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Part A 13:  Check the appropriate box depending on whether the cosigner is unmarried, separated, or married applying as an individual.

items.name: Cosigner Ethnicity Question
items.comment: Part A 14:  Providing cosigner's ethnicity is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on ethnicity, this information is required.

items.name: Gender
items.comment: Part A 15:   Providing cosigner's gender is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on gender, this information is required.

items.name: Cosigner Legal Competency Question
items.comment: Part 17:  Check the appropriate box to indicate if the cosigner has the legal capacity, age, mental capacity and authority to enter into a legal binding agreement.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Enter cosigner's initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Date the cosigner completed this form.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Notifications, Certifications, and Acknowledgment for the Cosigner

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part B 1:  Check "YES" if you ever conducted business under any other name, otherwise check "NO".  If "YES" provide the names used in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Part B 2:  Check "YES" if you ever obtained a direct or guaranteed farm loan from FSA or the Farmers Home Administration; otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Part B 3:  If item 2 is "YES," check "YES" if the government ever forgave any debt through write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy.  If "YES," provide details in Item 8, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Part B 4:  Check "YES" if you are delinquent on any federal debt (i.e. "Federal Debt" includes but is not limited to education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc., or have an outstanding Federal judgment).  If "YES", provide details in Item 8, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment: Part B 5:  Check "YES" if you are involved in any pending litigation i.e. divorce, law suit, etc..  If "YES" provide details in Item 8, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment: Part B 6:  Check "YES" if you have ever been in receivership, been discharged, or filed a petition for reorganization in bankruptcy.  If "YES" provide details in Item 8; otherwise check "NO."

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment: Part B 7:  Check "YES" if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency.  If "YES" provide details in Item 8, otherwise check "NO."

items.name: Additional answers
items.comment: Part B 8:  Provide explanations to an "YES" responses to Items 1-7. Use additional space as needed.

parts.name: Part C
parts.title: Certification and Cosigner Signatures
parts.description: CERTIFICATION: I acknowledge receipt of the above provisions, and by signing acknowledge that I have read this form, and accept the conditions stated herein. I further certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith to assist the applicant to obtain a loan. (WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements to the Government. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action).

items.name: Signature of Cosigner
items.comment: Part C 1(A):  Enter the signature of the cosigner.

items.name: Date Signed
items.comment: Part C 1(B):  Enter the date the cosigner signed.  If mailing the form, print the form and manually enter your signature.  This form is approved for electronic transmission.  If you have established credentials with USDA to submit forms electronically, use the buttons proved on the form for transmitting the form to the USDA servicing office.  Electronic submission may only be completed if you are the only person required to sign this form.

items.name: Name of Agency Official Receiving Application

items.name: Date FSA-2007 Received
items.comment: Part D 2:  FSA USE ONLY: The date the application was received, and date stamped by the office.

items.name: Date FSA-2001 Received From Applicant Listed in Part A, Item 6
items.comment: Part D 3:  FSA USE ONLY: The date the form FSA-2001 was received, and date stamped by the office.

items.name: Amount of Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: Part D 4:  FSA USE ONLY: The credit report fee is for pulling your credit report. The fee depends on how the applicant applies.

items.name: Date Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: Part D 5:  FSA USE ONLY: The date the credit report fee was received.
