items.comment: Part A 3 -   Read certification.  It is important for this form to go directly from FSA to the employer and then returned directly to FSA.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Part A 4 -   FSA USE ONLY - An FSA Agency Official will complete the name and physical address location of the servicing office reviewing the loan request. This will include the name of the registered street, the town/city and state where the property is located.

items.name: Title
items.comment: Part A 5 -   FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will list their official title (their professional title).

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part A 6 -   FSA USE ONLY - The Agency Official processing this form will list their signature.    Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part A 7 -   FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will list the month, date, and year this form is being completed to send to the Creditor.

items.name: Applicant's Name and Address
items.comment: Part A 8 -   FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form will list the month, date, and year this form is being completed to send to the Employer.

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Part A 9 - Read Statement.

items.name: Date of employment
items.comment: Part B 1-   Enter the applicant's date of employment. List the month, date, and year the applicant started working.

items.name: Position
items.comment: Part B 2 -   Enter the applicant's current position or job title.

items.name: Probability of continued employment
items.comment: Part B 3 -   Enter the applicant's probability of continuing to be employed. Do not leave blank.

items.name: Base pay
items.comment: Part B 4 -   Enter a checkmark in the appropriate box to indicate the applicant's base pay.  Include the dollar amount next to the box selected.    Annually - Annual gross salary earned over a 12-month basis.  Monthly - Monthly gross salary earned over a 30-day span.   Weekly - Weekly gross salary earned over a 7-day span.  Hourly - Hourly gross salary earned per hour.    If "Hourly" is selected, include the average number of hours per week  Other - (i.e. contract income, income from hired labor)

items.name: Past Year
items.comment: Part B 5 -   Enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions and Bonus amount earned within the past 12 months.  Base pay - The rate of compensation an employee receives for an exchange of services.   Overtime - Working time in excess of a standard day or week  Commissions - Fee paid to an agent or employee for transacting a piece of business or performing a service.  Bonus - Money added to base pay due to good performance

items.name: Current year to date pay
items.comment: Part B 6 -   Enter the current year to date in the space provided.    Enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions or Bonus amount for the current year to date.  Base pay - The rate of compensation an employee receives for an exchange of services.   Overtime - Working time in excess of a standard day or week  Commissions - Fee paid to an agent or employee for transacting a piece of business or performing a service.  Bonus - Money added to base pay due to good performance

items.name: Project next year pay
items.comment: Part B 7 -   Enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions or Bonus amount forecasted for the next 12-months.  Base pay - The rate of compensation an employee receives for an exchange of services.   Overtime - Working time in excess of a standard day or week  Commissions - Fee paid to an agent or employee for transacting a piece of business or performing a service.  Bonus - Money added to base pay due to good performance

items.name: Source
items.comment: Part C 1 -   Enter source of additional income received not listed on Part B.

items.name: Frequency
items.comment: Enter the frequency any other income is received.

items.name: Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount of the other income received.

items.name: Comments
items.comment: Enter any pertinent comments.

parts.name: Part D
parts.title: Certification
parts.description: Federal statutes provide severe civil and criminal penalties for any person who knowingly makes false or fraudulent statements or representations to a government agency or officer with the intention of influencing any action by such agency or officer.

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Part D 1 -   Read certification provided on the form.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Part D 2 -   Employer processing this form will print their name.

items.name: Title
items.comment: Part D 3 -   Employer processing this form will list their official title (their professional title).

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part D 4 -   Employer processing this form will provide their signature.    Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Phone Number
items.comment: Part D 5 -   Employer processing this form will provide the telephone number of the person who completed this form.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part D 6 -   Employer processing this form will provide the month, date, and year this form is being completed.

Forms.name: FSA-2037 Farm Business Plan Worksheet (Balance Sheet)
Forms.description: A balance sheet is prepared as of the current date. It is generally a snapshot of the customer's assets and debts as of a certain date.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Item 1 - Enter the applicants full legal name, an individuals first name, middle name and last name without the use of initials or nickname.

items.name: Date of Balance Sheet
items.comment: Item 2 - Enter the date representative of a specific point in time in which you are completing the balance sheet. Information provided below should be representative of this date.

parts.name: Part A
parts.title: Current Assets
parts.description: Current assets are FARM assets that can be sold immediately or consumed and converted to cash within 12 months.

items.name: Cash and Equivalents
items.comment: Item 1A - Enter balances of farm cash on hand, farm checking accounts and farm savings accounts.

items.name: Marketable Bonds and Securities
items.comment: Item 1B - Enter balances of short-term investments that will be maturing in less than 12 months. Examples: certificates of deposit, treasury bills, hedging account equity.

items.name: Accounts Receivable
items.comment: Item 1C - Enter balances of money owed to the applicant from sales or services to be received within the next 12 months.

items.name: Crop Inventory
items.comment: Item 1D - Enter the types of crops and feed in inventory/on hand on the farm or in commercial storage.

items.name: Unit of Measure
items.comment: Item 1E - Enter the unit of measure (weight, bushels, etc.)

items.name: # Units
items.comment: Item 1F - Enter the number of units held in storage.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: 1G - Enter price per unit of measure. Prices should be reflective of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: $ Value - Enter the total value of the crop. Number of units multiplied by the price per unit.

items.name: Growing Crops
items.comment: 1H - List each type of growing crops that are present in the field as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: # Acres
items.comment: 1I - Enter the total number of acres per specific crop.

items.name: Cost/Acre
items.comment: Item 1J - Enter the estimated input cost per acre for each crop growing. Input cost should include seed, fertilizer, fuel, etc.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: $ Value - Enter the total value of each crop. # acres x cost/acre = total value per crop

items.name: Market Livestock-Poultry
items.comment: Item 1K - List types of livestock/poultry that will be sold within 12 months.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: Item 1L - Enter the number of each type of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: Weight
items.comment: Item 1M - Enter the average weight for each type of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: Item 1N - Enter the market price per unit as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: $ Value - Enter the total value of each type of livestock to be sold. # of head x weight x $/unit = total value

items.name: Livestock Products
items.comment: Item 1O - Enter the type of livestock product that will be sold within 12 months. Example: meat, eggs, fur, leather, wool, etc.

items.name: Unit of Measure
items.comment: Item 1P - Enter the unit  of measure the livestock product is sold as.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: Item 1Q - Enter the number of units held in inventory for each type of livestock product.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: Item 1R - Enter the price per unit for each product as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: $ Value - Enter the total value for each type of livestock product. # units x $/unit = total value

items.name: Prepaid Expenses and Supplies
items.comment: Item 1S - Enter the total value of supplies on hand and prepaid expenses. Examples: fertilizers, seeds, chemicals, fuel, etc. The value for prepaid expenses should be the cost value.

items.name: Other Current Assets
items.comment: Item 1T - Enter the description and value of any other current asset that has not be accounted for. Other current assets are items that are untypical of value that a company owns or uses to generate income within one business cycle. Example: trade receivables, cash surrender of life insurance, advances paid to employees or suppliers

items.name: Total Current Assets
items.comment: Item 1U - Enter the total value of all current assets listed in Items 1A through 1T.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Current Liabilities
parts.description: Current liabilities are FARM debts that are owed and to be paid within the next 12 months.

items.name: Accounts Payable
items.comment: 2A - Enter the name of the lender, dealer, bank or individual to whom money is owed on an account that was due and payable within 30 days and list the amount that is now past due. (Example: suppliers, credit cards, land rent/lease payments, vet bills, IRS debts, bank fees, open accounts)

items.name: Income Taxes Payable
items.comment: Item 2 B - Enter taxes owed such as State, Federal income and Social Security taxes.

items.name: Real Estate Taxes Payable
items.comment: Item 2C - Enter taxes owed on real estate and personal property as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Timeframe Note
items.comment: Loans due within the next 12 months. This includes any installments due within the next 12 months for longer term liabilities.

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: Item 2D - Enter the name of each creditor for notes due within 12 months.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: Item 2E - Enter the purpose for each note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: Item 2F - Enter the interest rate for each note listed.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: Item 2G - Enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: Item 2H - Enter the amount due within the next 12 months for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: Item 2I - Enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: Item 2J - Enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Accrued Interest On
items.comment: Item 2K - Enter the total accrued interest for current liabilities, intermediate liabilities and long term liabilities.

items.name: Current Portion of Principal Due On
items.comment: Item 2L - Enter the current portion of principal due on intermediate liabilities and long term liabilities.

items.name: Other Current Liabilities
items.comment: Item 2M - Enter the name of the creditor and amount due of any other current or insignificant liabilities due within the next 12 months not listed above.

items.name: Total Current Liabilities
items.comment: Item 2N - Enter the total of all current liabilities of items 2A through 2M.

parts.name: Part C
parts.title: Intermediate Assets
parts.description: Intermediate assets are assets with a useful life of 2-7 years.

items.name: Machinery & Equipment/Farm Vehicles
items.comment: Item C-3A - Enter the total value of machinery and equipment listed on page 4.

items.name: Breeding Stock
items.comment: Item C-3B - Enter all types of breeding stock owned.

items.name: Raised or Purchased
items.comment: Item C-3C - Enter R for raised or P for purchased for each type of breeding stock entered.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: Item C-3D - Enter the number of each type of breeding stock.

items.name: $/Head
items.comment: Item C-3E - Enter the current market price per animal for each type of breeding stock as of the balance sheet effective date.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Item C $ Value - Enter the value for each type of breeding livestock.  # of head x $/head = total value

items.name: Notes Receivable
items.comment: Item C-3F - Enter money owed to the applicant that will not be received in the current year, but will be received within 10 years.

items.name: Not Readily Marketable Bonds and Securities
items.comment: Item C-3G - Enter other investments and the value of each. Example: certificates of deposit, treasury bills, etc.

items.name: Other Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Item C-3H - Enter other intermediate assets such as co-op stock, life insurance cash value, etc.

items.name: Total Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Item C-3I - Enter the total of all intermediate farm assets from Items 3A through 3 H.

parts.name: Part D
parts.title: Long Term Assets
parts.description: Long term assets are assets with a useful life of longer than 7 years.

items.name: Building and Improvements
items.comment: Item D-4A - List all buildings and improvements owned and the value of each.

items.name: Real Estate Land
items.comment: Part D-4B - Provide brief description of each real estate parcel owned.

items.name: Total Acres
items.comment: Item D-4C - Enter total acres for the parcel listed in 4B.

items.name: Cros Acres
items.comment: Item D-4D - Enter total crop acres for land listed in 4B.

items.name: % Owned
items.comment: Item D-4E - Enter percent of ownership applicant holds for land listed in 4B.

items.name: $/Acre
items.comment: Item D-4F - Enter value per acre.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Enter value of land. Total acres x % owned x $/acre = value of land

items.name: Other Long Term Assets
items.comment: Item D-4G - Enter the current market value of any other type of long term farm asset not listed.

items.name: Total Long Term Assets
items.comment: Item D-4H - Enter the total of all long term assets from 4A through 4G.

items.name: Total Farm Assets
items.comment: Item D-4I - Enter the total value of all farm assets listed.  Total current assets + total intermediate assets + total long term assets = total farm assets

parts.name: Part E
parts.title: Intermediate Liabilities
parts.description: Intermediate liabilities are liabilities with a term of 2-7 years.

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: Item E-5A - Enter the name of each creditor for notes due within 2-7 years.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: Item E-5B - Enter the purpose for each note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: Item E-5C - Enter the interest rate for each note listed.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: Item E-5D - Enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: Item E-5E - Enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: Item E-5F - Enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: Item E-5G - Enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Total Intermediate Liabilities
items.comment: Item E -5H - Enter total of all intermediate liabilities from 5G.

parts.name: Part F
parts.title: Long Term Liabilities
parts.description: Long term liabilities are liabilities with a term longer than 7 years.

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: Item F-6A - Enter the name of each creditor for notes due longer than 7 years.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: Item F-6B - Enter the purpose for each note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: Item F-6C - Enter the interest rate for the note listed.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: Item F-6D - Enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: Item F-6E - Enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: Item F-6F - Enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: Item F-6G - Enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Total Long Term Liabilities
items.comment: Item F-6H - Enter the total long term liabilities from column 6G.

items.name: Total Farm Liabilities
items.comment: Item F-6I - Enter the total farm liabilities. 2N + 5H + 6H = total farm liabilities

items.name: Total Farm Equity
items.comment: Item F-6J - Enter total farm equity.  4I - 6I = total farm equity

items.name: Cash and Equivalents
items.comment: Item G-7A - Enter the value of cash on hand, checking accounts and savings accounts.

items.name: Stocks, Bonds
items.comment: Item G-7B - Enter the value of personal stocks and bonds.

items.name: Cash Value Life Insurance
items.comment: Item G-7C - Enter the cash value of life insurance policies if applicable.

items.name: Other Current Assets
items.comment: Item G-7D - Enter the value of any other personal current assets.

items.name: Household Goods
items.comment: Item G-7E - Enter the value of all household goods.

items.name: Car, Recreational Vehicle, Etc.
items.comment: Item G-7F - Enter the value of all personal, recreational , or non-farm vehicles.

items.name: Other Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Item G-7G - Enter the value of any other personal intermediate assets.

items.name: Retirement Accounts
items.comment: Item G-7H - Enter the value of retirement accounts.

items.name: Non-Farm Business
items.comment: Item G-7I - Enter the value of all non-farm businesses.

items.name: Non-Farm Real Estate
items.comment: Item G-7J - Enter value of non-farm real estate.

items.name: Ohter Long Term Assets
items.comment: Item G-7K - Enter the value of any other long term assets.

items.name: Total Personal Assets
items.comment: Item G-7L - Enter the total value of personal assets of items 7A through 7K.

items.name: Total Assets
items.comment: Item G-7M - Enter the total value of all assets.  Total farm assets + total personal assets = total assets

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: Item H-8A - Enter the name of each creditor for a personal liability.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: Item H-8B - Enter the purpose of the liability.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: Item H-8C - Enter the interest rate for each personal liability.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: Item H-8D - Enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: Item H-8E - Enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: Item H-8F - Enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: Item H-8G - Enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Other Liabilities
items.comment: Item H-8H - Enter any other personal liability not listed.

items.name: Total Personal Liabilities
items.comment: Item H-8I - Enter total value of all personal liabilities.

items.name: Total Liabilities
items.comment: Item H-8J - Enter the total amount of liabilities of personal and farm liabilities.

items.name: Total Equity
items.comment: Item H-8K - Enter the total equity.  Total assets - total liabilities =  total equity

parts.name: Part I
parts.title: Warning
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warning: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Item I-9A Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Item I-9B  Enter the specific month, day and year the applicant has signed the form.

items.name: Comments
items.comment: Item I -10 - Enter any comments or attach documentation that may be needed to clarify any information provided on this form.

items.name: Quantity
items.comment: Item J-11A - Enter the number of each type of equipment owned. (Include shared percentage of equipment)

items.name: Description
items.comment: Item J-11B - Enter description of the type of equipment.

items.name: Manufacturer
items.comment: Item J-11C - Enter the manufacturer of the equipment listed in 11B.

items.name: Size/Type
items.comment: Item J-11D - Enter size and type of equipment listed in 11B.

items.name: Condition
items.comment: Item J-11E - Enter condition of the equipment listed in 11B.  Condition can be described as excellent, good, average, fair or poor.

items.name: Year
items.comment: Item J-11F - Enter the year of manufacture.

items.name: Serial Number
items.comment: Item J-11G - Enter the serial number (a unique identifier assigned to a particular piece of machinery or equipment).

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Item J-11H - Enter the current market value as of the date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Total $ value of Item 1H
items.comment: Item J-11I - Enter the total value of all machinery or  equipment.

items.name: Quantity
items.comment: Item K-12A - Enter the number of each type of farm vehicle owned.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Item K-12B - Enter description of the type of farm vehicle. For example, green truck, red side by side, etc.

items.name: Manufacturer
items.comment: Item K-12C - Enter the manufacturer of the farm vehicle listed in 12A.

items.name: Size/Type
items.comment: Item K-12D - Enter the size/type of the farm vehicle.

items.name: Condition
items.comment: Item K-12E - Enter condition of the farm vehicle listed in 11B.  Condition can be described as excellent, good, average, fair or poor.

items.name: Year
items.comment: Item K-12F - Enter the year of manufacture.

items.name: Serial Number/VIN
items.comment: Item K-12G - Enter the serial number/VIN (a unique identifier assigned to vehicles) of the farm vehicle.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Item K-12H - Enter the current market value as of the date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Total $ Value of 12H
items.comment: Item K-12I - Enter the total value of all farm vehicles.

items.name: Total $ Value Of (Items 11I and 12I) Transfer to Item 3A
items.comment: Item K-12J - Enter the combined total value of all machinery, equipment and farm vehicles.

Forms.name: FSA-2038 Farm Business Plan Worksheet (Projected/Actual Income and Expense)

items.name: Name
items.comment: Item 1: Enter the full Name of the applicant as indicated on FSA 2001

items.name: For Production Cycle Beginning
items.comment: Item 2: Enter the beginning  date and end date of the crop cycle year. Example Oct 1, 2020 thru Sept 30, 2021. Also, Indicate whether the information is for actual or projected. Actual means; existing yields , cost, units, acreage etc that is used to develop a trend or part of a history for the existing/current crops Projected means: an estimation or forecast base on the current trends or data to be used for the upcoming crop cycle.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A (1 A).:  Input a description of the various crops projected to be planted during the crop cycle. List each crop per farm/ tract number, utilizing the production for each. For example 3,000 acres of cotton must be broken out into farm numbers if the entire acreage is not one farm number. Then the yields from each farm/tract number must be listed and will be used to calculate the projected income for that particular farm. Do not combine farm/tract numbers. Please add additional sheets/paper to account for each type of crops if you need additional space.

items.name: Acres
items.comment: Part A(1B) indicate the total acreage to be planted on each tract/farm number for that particular crop.

items.name: Yield
items.comment: Part A (1C) -enter the average actual production yield per crop for each tract or farm number. Do not use the average of the combined yields for that crop, because each farm tract will have different yields. Use APH insurance yields. Then county or state yields if you have no actual production yields or records from previous owner (s)..

items.name: % Share
items.comment: Part A:(1D); Percent share is the allocation/amount of crop share as indicated on lease or rent contract from a rent/lease agreement with landlords. It is the shared amount from crop acreages planted that the applicant will receive. This number or amount will be used to calculate the projections for that particular farm or crops  (67%, 33.33%, 50% etc based on crop shares.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: Part A (1E); enter the measurable units used to indicate volume/ quantity of the crops to be produced; for example bushel of corn, cwt for rice/soybeans, lbs for cotton etc.

items.name: Farm Use
items.comment: Part A: (1F) Enter the quantity or volume of crops held back to be used specifically for the farm and will not be a part of the total projected income calculated from crop sales. Example: Quantify of hay held back to be used for livestock feed.

items.name: # Units Purchased
items.comment: Part A: (1G); Enter the number of units for each crop to be purchased or purchased for sale. (use item 1G, 1H & 1I for purchases only.

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment: Part A: (1H) Enter the price per unit for each crop to be purchased or actually  purchased for sale.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment: Part A: (1I) Enter the total amount for each crop to be purchased or actually purchased for sale

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A ; (1J) Enter the total number of units projected to be sold or actually sold from each crop

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: (1K) Enter the price per unit for each crop projected to be sold or actually sold.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment: Part A;(1L) Enter the total amount for each crop to be sold or actually sold. (Item 1J x Item 1K).

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A: Item 2A; enter a description of the type of livestock to be raised; for example (broiler chicken, finishing pigs, stocker cattle, catfish fish, meat goats etc)

items.name: Purchased/Raised
items.comment: Part A; Item 2B Entire the number of animals purchased (P), then fattened with plans to sell at a later date. Or enter the number of animals raised (R)). ( animals that are off-springs  of existing livestock and raised by the farmer from birth to time of weaning for sale.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: Part A: Item 2c: enter the total number of each type of livestock projected to be sold

items.name: Weight Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 2D: Enter the average weight per unit of livestock  purchased or raised for sale.

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 2E: Enter the $/Unit for each type of livestock  purchased or raised  for sale. $/unit could be the cost per animal or the  cost per pound live weight for each type of livestock.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 2F: Enter the Total $ amount for each type of livestock to be purchased or purchased for sale.  calculate using Items 2C x 2D x 2E).

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: Part A: Item 2G: Enter the loss due to death for each type of livestock. For example of the total number of units  in item 2C how many died that will not be sold.

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 2H: enter the total number of livestock to be sold after deducting the total numbers that died.

items.name: Weight Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 2I: enter the projected or actual weight of each animal to be sold

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 2J: enter price per $/unit for each livestock projected to be sold or actually sold.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 2K: Enter the Total dollar amount for each livestock type projected to be sold or actually sold.  (Items 2H x 2I x 2J)

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A; Item 3A: Enter a description for each type of dairy livestock. ( sheep, goat, cows etc)

items.name: Purchased/Raised
items.comment: Part A: Item 3B: Enter purchased or raised (the meaning of raised is an offspring of the animals raised by the farmer from birth to the time of weaning for sale).

items.name: # Head
items.comment: Part A; Item 3C: Enter the total number of heads for the dairy livestock

items.name: Weight Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 3D: Enter the average weight per unit of dairy livestock to be purchased or actually purchased

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 3E: Enter the $/Unit for each type of dairy livestock to be purchased or actually purchased.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment: Part A: Item 3F: Enter the Total $ amount for each type of dairy livestock to be purchased or actually purchased. (Items 3C x 3D x 3E)

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: Part A: Item 3G: Enter the loss due to death for each type of dairy livestock.

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 3H: Enter the number of units of dairy livestock to be sold or actually sold

items.name: Weight Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 3I:  Enter the weight per unit of dairy livestock to be sold or actually sold.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 3J: Enter the $/Unit for each type of dairy livestock to be sold or actually sold.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 3K: Enter the Total $ amount for each type of dairy livestock to be sold or actually sold. (Items 3H x 3I x 3J)

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A: Item 4A: Enter a description of the  type of milk (dairy cows, sheep, goat.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: Part A: Item 4B:  Enter the number of heads of livestock in production.

items.name: Production/Head/Year
items.comment: Part A: Item 4C: Enter the production per head per year for each type of animal .

items.name: Total Production
items.comment: Part A: Item 4D: Enter the total production per year. (Item 4B x Item 4C)

items.name: Price
items.comment: Part A: Item 4E: Enter the current market price per unit measurement ( pounds, quart/ gallon), for the type of milk produced.

items.name: Sales $
items.comment: Part A: Item 4F: Enter the total annual sales. (Item 4D x Item 4E) from milk produced .

items.name: Description
items.comment: Part A: Item 5A: Enter a description of the the type of livestock producing the commodity for sale. (Sheep, Goats, Poultry , cattle, emu).

items.name: Production
items.comment: Part A: Item 5B: Enter the type of commodity produced. (Wool, fur, hide, Eggs, meat from broiler chicks etc.)

items.name: Measure
items.comment: Part A: Item 5C: Enter the unit of measurement of the commodity to be sold or sold, such as weight or numbers. (Pounds of Wool, Dozens of Eggs)

items.name: Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 5D: Enter the number of Units to be sold or actually sold. for each type of commodity.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 5E: Enter the $/Unit to be sold or actually sold.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment: Part A: Item 5F: Enter the Total $ amount for livestock products to be sold or actually  sold. (Item 5D x  item 5E)

items.name: Ag Program Payments Type
items.comment: Part A, Page 2A Item 6: Enter the type of all farm program payments or subsidy, subsidy/payments projected to be received or actually received during the production cycle. (Separate by program).

items.name: Ag Program Payment Amount
items.comment: Enter amount of money to be received or actually received from program payments

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds Description
items.comment: Page 2A. Item 7: Enter all crop insurance payments/proceeds to be received or actually received.

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds Amount
items.comment: Enter the  amount of money received or projected from crop insurance proceeds

items.name: Custom Hire Description / Amount
items.comment: Part A, Page 2A, Item 8: Enter a description or type of work performed and income received or projected from custom work done. This could include machine work.

items.name: Other Income Description / Amount
items.comment: Part A Page 2A, Item 9: Describe any other farm income  such as money from rental properties, leasing of equipment/livestock,  and enter amount received or projected.

items.name: Total Income
items.comment: Part A; Page 2A Item 10: Enter the combined total dollar amount  for the entire Part A. (Line Items 1-9).

items.name: Expense Categories
items.comment: Part B; Page 2, Item 11-Expenses: identify the type of expenses common to your operation and input the amount of expense you are projecting for the crop year  which you are applying for a loan.

items.name: Interest
items.comment: Page 2-Expenses (32). Enter projected amount of operating & term interest to be paid during the crop year

items.name: Total Expenses
items.comment: Page 2 (33). Input the total operating expenses (line 11-32).

items.name: Owner Withdrawal
items.comment: Page 2 C (#34). Enter the total for family living expenses. Include all household operating expenses such as groceries, utilities, health insurance and all non-farm debt payments to include personal  home mortgage, car note and credit card debts.

items.name: Income Taxes
items.comment: Page 2C (# 35) Enter the State and Federal income tax to be paid or paid during the production cycle

items.name: Non-Farm Income
items.comment: Page 2 C(# 36) Enter all income from non-farm sources.

items.name: Non-Farm Expense
items.comment: Page 2 C (# 37): Enter all expenses associated with non-farm businesses.

items.name: Capital Sales
items.comment: Page 2D (#38) Enter the dollar amount to be received or received from the sale of depreciable items (equipment, breeding livestock) and real estate during the production cycle.

items.name: Capital Contributions
items.comment: Page 2D  (#39): Enter inflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or other income Examples .such as   gifts, inheritance, lottery winnings, the gift-value of substantial asset purchases for less than market value, and the capital contributions of entity members.

items.name: Capital Expenditures
items.comment: Page 2D (#40): Enter the purchase of depreciable items (equipment, breeding livestock) and real estate during the production cycle

items.name: Capital Withdrawals
items.comment: Page 2D (#41): Enter outflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or owner withdrawals.  For example; Capital withdrawals usually include gifts, the gift-value of substantial sales of assets for less than market value, and withdrawals of capital by entity members.

parts.name: Part E
parts.title: Warning
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warn Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any informatio found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Page 2 E (#42A) After completing and reviewing this form,  ensure all correct information are entered correctly, sign in the signature box

items.name: Date
items.comment: 42B Enter date the form is signed by the applicant.

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Part A 1. List the applicant's full legal name.  The full legal name means an individual's first name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or a nickname.

items.name: Address
items.comment: Part A 2. List the applicants mailing address location.  This will include the name of the registered street, the town/city and state.

items.name: County of Project
items.comment: Part A 3. Enter the County where the project will be completed.

items.name: Email Address
items.comment: Part A 4. Enter the applicant's e-mail address.

items.name: Social Security Number
items.comment: Part A 5. Enter the applicant's social security number (9 digits).

items.name: Birth Date
items.comment: Part A 6. Enter the applicant's date of birth.

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment: Part A 7. Enter applicant's home (landline), cell and/or business telephone number as applicable.

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Part A 8. Check the appropriate box depending on whether the applicant is unmarried, separated, or married applying as an individual.

items.name: Amount of Loan Request
items.comment: Part A 9. Enter the loan amount being requested with this application.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Part A 10. Check the applicable citizenship status.  If non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, as defined by the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996, 8 U.S. C. 1641, cosigner must provide copies of appropriate documentation of immigration status including and not limited, to a current I-551, Naturalization Certificate, or I688B.  Other than U.S. Citizen, please provide documentation to document immigration status.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Part A 11. Check "YES" if you ever obtained a direct or guaranteed loan from FSA, if no, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Part A 12. Check "YES" if you are delinquent on any federal debt (i.e. "Federal Debt" includes but is not limited to education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, or have an outstanding Federal judgment, etc.).  If "YES", provide details in Item 9, otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Part A 13. Check "YES" if the government ever forgave any debt on a FSA direct or guaranteed loan through a write-off, debt settlement, compromise, write-down, charge-off, adjustment, reduction or bankruptcy and provide an explanation in Item 18.  If not, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment: Part A 14. Check "YES" if employed and enter the name, mailing address and telephone number of the employer.  Also provide the annual income and if employment is full or part time in Item 18.  If self-employed answer yes and state "SELF" in Item 18 and refer to "14."  If not employed, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment: Part A 15. Check "YES" if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency, and provide an explanation in Item 18.  If not, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment: Part A 16. Check "YES" if you ae an active member of FFA, 4-H or other agriculture related organization.  Provide the name of the organization that will sponsor you for this project in Item 18.  If not, check "NO".

items.name: Yes/No Question #8
items.comment: Part A 17. Check "YES" if you are a veteran that has served in any branch of the military or armed forces.   A Veteran Farmer without military experience does not qualify as a Veteran If not, check "NO".

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment: Part A 18. Use this space to provide additional answers to questions on this application.  Refer to the number of the question when adding an explanation i.e. 14. I am currently employed at the local Gas for You convenience store part-time located at  100 South Main Street, Any Town, Any State.  Phone number 111-222-3333.  I earn $12,000 per year.

items.name: Brief Description of Project
items.comment: Part A 19. Provide a brief description of the proposed project that you are looking to finance.

parts.name: Voluntary
parts.title: Voluntary Information
parts.description: VOLUNTARY INFORMATION FOR MONITORING PURPOSES: Race, ethnicity and gender information is requested by the Federal Government in order to monitor FSA's compliance with Federal laws prohibiting discrimination against loan applicants. You are not required to furnish this information, but are encouraged to do so. Failure to complete this information may result in you not receiving access to targeted funds for which you may have been eligible. This information will not be used in evaluating your application or to discriminate against you in any way. If you do not furnish it, FSA is required to note your race, ethnicity and gender on the basis of observer identification. (*This data is requested for statistical purposes only. One or more boxes may be selected.)

items.name: Ethnicity
items.comment: Part A 20 A:  Providing applicant's ethnicity is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on ethnicity, this information is required.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to ethnicity

items.name: Race
items.comment: Part A 20 B:  Race:   Check the appropriate box indicating applicant's race.  More than one box may be checked.  Providing applicant's race is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on race, this information is required.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to race

items.name: Gender
items.comment: Part A 20 C:   Providing applicant's gender is voluntary; however, if applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant based on gender, this information is required.   Non- Binary is defined as an individual who identifies as neither male or female.  Check the "I prefer not to share" box if you choose not to share any information related to gender.

items.name: Income Description
items.comment: Part A 21. A. Enter the description of each projected source of income. In example beef cattle heifers/steers, market lambs, dairy heifer, etc.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Part A 21. B. Enter the projected annual dollar amount of income to be received from each source described.

items.name: Total
items.comment: Part A 22. Enter the projected total annual dollar amount of income from all sources listed.  Total of Column 21 B.

items.name: Expense Description
items.comment: Part A 23. A. Enter the description for each projected expense. In example feed expense, bedding expense, supplies, etc.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Part A 23 B. Enter the projected annual dollar amount for each expense described.

items.name: Total
items.comment: Part A 24. Enter the projected total annual dollar amount of all expenses listed under 23 B.

items.name: Annual Total Income from Item 22
items.comment: Part A 25. Enter the projected total annual dollar amount of income from line 22.

items.name: Annual Total Expenses from Item 24
items.comment: Part A 26. Enter the total annual dollar amount of all expenses from Item 24.

items.name: Annual Amount of Payments Due
items.comment: Part A 27. Enter the estimated annual dollar amount of all debt payments due, including the loan being requested with this application.

items.name: Ending Cash Balance
items.comment: Part A 28. Subtract Item 26 "Annual Total Expenses" and 27 "Annual Amount of Payments Due" from Item 25 "Annual Total Income" to complete Item 28 "Ending Cash Balance".

items.name: Asset Description
items.comment: Part A 29 A. Enter a description for each of your assets.  i.e. car, 3 heifers, 2 ewes, etc.  List things that you own.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Part A 29 B.  Enter the dollar value for each asset that you have described.

items.name: Total Assets
items.comment: Part A 30. Enter the total dollar value of all assets that you have described.  Total of Column 29 B.

items.name: Debt Description
items.comment: Part A 31 A. Enter a description of all debts that you have.  Money that you owe to lending institutions, creditors or individuals.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Part A 31 B.  Enter the dollar value for each debt that you have described.

items.name: Total Debts
items.comment: Part A 32. Enter the total dollar amount of all debts described.  Total of column 31 B.

items.name: Total Assets from Item 30
items.comment: Part A 33. Enter the dollar amount of total assets from Item 30.

items.name: Total Debts from Item 32
items.comment: Part A 34. Enter the dollar amount of the total debts from Item 32.

items.name: Net Worth
items.comment: Part A 35. Enter the net worth by subtracting Item 34 from Item 33.

items.name: Special Program Information
items.comment: Part A 36. PLEASE READ.

items.name: General Information
items.comment: Part A 37. PLEASE READ.

items.name: Certification
items.comment: Part A 38. PLEASE READ.

items.name: Warning
items.comment: Part A 39 PLEASE READ.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part A 40A. Enter the applicant (s) signature  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part A 40B. Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Project Advisor Role Description
items.comment: Part B 41A. Enter a brief description of how you plan to assist the applicant and your plan for supervision.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Part B 41B. Print the advisor's name.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part B 41C. Enter the project advisor's signature. Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Title Within Organization
items.comment: Part B 41D. Enter the project advisor's title within the organization (leader, advisor, teacher, County Extension agent, etc.)

items.name: Organization Affiliation
items.comment: Part B 41E. Enter the name of the agricultural organization with which the project advisor is associated i.e. 4-H, FFA, school instructor, etc.

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment: Part B 41F. Enter the contact phone number for the project advisor.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part B 41G. Enter the specific month, date and year the project advisor has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Parent/Guardian Role Description
items.comment: Part C 42A. Enter a brief description of how you plan to assist the applicant with the proposed project.  In example provide shelter for project animal, provide daily supervision and guidance, etc.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Part C 42B Enter the name of the parent or guardian.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Part C 42C Enter the signature of the parent or guardian.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Part C 42D Enter the specific month, date and year the parent or guardian has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Date Form FSA-2301 Received
items.comment: Part D 43A FSA USE ONLY: The date the application was received, and date stamped by the office.

items.name: Date Application Complete
items.comment: Part D 43B. FSA USE ONLY: The date the application was complete by providing all required documentation.

items.name: Credit Report Fee
items.comment: Part D 43C FSA USE ONLY: A credit report fee is charged each time a new application is filed (for applicants 18 years or older). The credit report fee amount will depend on whether the applicant applies as an individual, joint entity, or an entity.    The credit report fee is nonrefundable.

items.name: Date Received
items.comment: Part D 43D Enter the date the credit report fee is received.

items.name: Name of Agency Official
items.comment: Part D 43E Enter the name of the Agency Official receiving the application and/or credit report fee.

parts.name: Instructions
parts.title: General Information
parts.description: For new applicants or applicants adding new enterprise only.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as filled on FSA 2001for an individual. If this is an entity, enter the entity name.

items.name: Training
items.comment: Enter a brief description of the farm or related training you, or entity members have received in farm principles such as farm financial and production management, recordkeeping, and marketing. This could also include college courses, internships, summer jobs and any other hands on training.

items.name: Experience
items.comment: You will enter a brief description of your farming experience, include the type of jobs, duties and responsibilities you have had in farming operations. For example did you work as a laborer what did you do, did you manage a farm what did you do, how many employees, their roles/responsibilities, were you responsible for payroll, time & attendance, record keeping etc. Describe combine years of experience among entity members.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Enter the applicant (s) signature  Signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document to authorize their true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.

items.name: Name
items.comment: Item 1 -   Enter the applicants full legal name, an individual's first name, middle name and last name without the use of initials or nicknames.

items.name: Disaster Number
items.comment: Item 2 -   FSA USE ONLY: To be completed by FSA.

items.name: Crop Year
items.comment: Item 3 -   FSA USE ONLY: To be completed by FSA.

items.name: Date(s) and Nature of Disaster
items.comment: Item 4 -    Enter the date(s) the disaster took place and the kind of disaster that occurred.

items.name: Cash Crop Names
items.comment: Item 5A(1) -   List all cash crops or crops grown to be sold in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Feed Crop Names
items.comment: Item 5A(2) - List all feed crops or crops grown to be used as feed for your operation in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Other Crop Names
items.comment: Item 5A(3) - List all other crops not listed above such as pasture for the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Units of Measure
items.comment: Item 5B - Enter the unit of measure for each crop listed. Example: tons, bushels, lbs., etc.

items.name: Acres
items.comment: Item 5C -   Enter the total number of acres planted for each crop listed for the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Yield per Acre
items.comment: Item 5D -   Enter the yield per acre for each crop listed in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Item 5E (1, 2, 3) - Enter the three previous years.

items.name: Yield per Acre and Source Code
items.comment: Item 5E Yield -  Enter the yield per acre for each crop for each of the three years listed.   Enter the source code for each crop for each of the three years listed.   A source codes refers to where you obtained your yield per acre or production information from. Source code options are: (1) for owner's records, (2) for FSA program yields, or (3) if using the county/state average.

items.name: APH Insured Yield per Acre
items.comment: Item 5F -   FSA USE ONLY: To be completed by FSA.

items.name: Normal Year Yield
items.comment: Item 5G -  FSA USE ONLY: To be completed by FSA.

items.name: Farm Operation Description
items.comment: Item 6 - Enter the enterprise or type of operation that suffered the disaster loss.  For example, crop operation, cattle operation, dairy operation, poultry operation etc.

items.name: Dwelling(s)
items.comment: Item 7A(1) - Enter the description of the damages and losses to the dwelling(s) or place of residence. Please attach an actual estimate for repair or replacement of the damaged property.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7A(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of losses for the dwelling(s).

items.name: Household furnishings, equipment, and personal effects
items.comment: Item 7B(1) - Enter a description of the damages and losses to the household furnishings, equipment and personal effects. Please attach an actual estimate for repair or replacement of the damaged property.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7B(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of losses for household furnishings, equipment and personal effects.

items.name: Farming buildings
items.comment: Item 7C(1) - Enter a description of the damages and losses to the farm buildings. Specify the type/purpose of the building. For example, shop, barn, machinery shed, livestock shelter etc.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7C(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of losses for the farm buildings.

items.name: Farm machinery and equipment
items.comment: Item 7D(1) - Enter a description of the damages and losses to farm machinery or equipment. Please specify the make, model and year for any machinery or equipment damaged. Please attach an actual estimate for repair or replacement of the damaged machinery or equipment.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7D(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses to any farm machinery and equipment.

items.name: Supplies, harvested or stored crops and livestock products
items.comment: Item 7E(1) - Enter a description of the damages and losses to supplies (i.e. tools of the trade, filters, generators), harvested or stored crops, and livestock products.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7E(2) Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses for supplies, harvested or stored crops, and livestock products.

items.name: Livestock and poultry
items.comment: Item 7F(1) - Enter a description of the damages and losses to livestock and poultry. Please specify the type of livestock or poultry and the number damaged or destroyed.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7F(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses to livestock and poultry.

items.name: Aquatic organisms
items.comment: Item 7G(1) - Enter a description of the damage and losses to aquatic organisms. Please specify the type and number damaged or destroyed. For example, aquaculture

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7G(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses to aquatic organisms.

items.name: Perennial crops
items.comment: Item 7H(1) - Enter a description of the damage and losses to perennial crops. Please specify the crop and number of acres. Perennial crops are not planted each year. For example, fruit trees, pecans, grapes, alfalfa, and vegetable crops).

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7H(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses to perennial crops. Include the cost to clear debris, prepare the land for replanting, and to reestablish the crop.

items.name: Other farm property
items.comment: Item 7I(1) - Enter a description of damage and losses to other farm property not detailed above such as fences, land damage, debris removal, etc.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Item 7I(2) - Enter the estimated dollar value of the losses to other farm property.

items.name: Total Physical Losses
items.comment: Item 8 - Enter the total dollar amount of all losses listed above.

items.name: Remarks
items.comment: Item 9 - Please provide any other additional information necessary to help process the application.

items.name: Insurance/Compensation Source
items.comment: Item 10A - List all sources of insurance or other compensation received or to be received for losses suffered by the disaster. Example: insurance claims or settlements, disaster program payments, FCIC settlements

items.name: Crop or Property
items.comment: Item 10B - List the crop or property for which the compensation was received.

items.name: Dollar Amount
items.comment: Item 10C - List the dollar amounts received of any compensation for the losses incurred to the crop or property caused by the disaster.

items.name: Total Insurance and Other Compensation
items.comment: Item 10D - List the combined total dollar amount received in compensation for the losses incurred. (Sum of all entries in column 10C.)

items.name: FSA Farm Number
items.comment: Item 11A -   Enter the farm tract number of the land you own, lease or plan to purchase. The farm tract number is available from FSA - Farm Program Section.   For newly purchased land, it is required that you obtain a tract number from FSA - Farm Program Section.

items.name: County Farm is Located
items.comment: Item 11B - List the county where the farm is located.

items.name: Name of Farm Operator as Reflected by FSA Records
items.comment: Item 11C - List the name of the farm operator as reported to FSA.

items.name: Operator's Share of Crops
items.comment: Item 11D - List the operator's percentage of ownership in the crops produced on each farm.

items.name: FSA Remarks
items.comment: Item 11E -   FOR FSA USE ONLY: To be completed by FSA.

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Item 12 - Please read certification statement prior to signing and dating the form.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Item 13A - Enter the applicant's signature.  A signature is a distinctive way as a form of identification on a document, to authorize one's true certification.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Item 13B - Enter the specific month, date and year the applicant has completed and signed the form.
